result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karen E Bradley

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Karen E Bradley in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court for Karen E Bradley.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Defense requests an adjourned date. State has no objection. Court grants request. Case adjourned, Branch 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defense counsel contacted the Court via telephone and requested an adjournment due to personal issues and asked that case be placed on calendar for plea and sentencing. Court grants adjournment and orders case set for plea and sentencing. Case remains calendared in Br 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Case called on the record: Same appearance. 
Defense moves to modify the no contact with Firearm restriction to reflect  Defendant to not to possess any firearms EXCEPT to complete a firearm safety course.
State does not object if a handling a firearm is required for the course.  Court Granted defense motion and modiifed the no contact with firearm restriction to reflect:
No Fiream unless for the sole purpose  to compete the Firearm Safety Course.

Defendant Karen E Bradley in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.  Discussion held off the record. 
Defense counsel recently appointed and awaiting discovery and offer in this case. Court ordered matter adjourned.
Parties advised: Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  
Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Karen E Bradley in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/02/2022@130p
